column4: Hey is there an easy way to transfer all my settings to another Ubuntu installation?
that can be done with the 'dpkg' command IIRC
I can look it up, unless someone else knows right now
Yeah that would be awesome if you could look it up for me. Or tell me where to go...
K (this captures the existing apps installed; I don't believe it transfers other files (like config files) tho)
I might be better off just doing it all over again in that case. It dosn't take to long with SPM
I would think that in a linux enviroment, where it take significantly more time to get things setup the way you like, there would be such a "Files and Settings Transfer Wizard"
I have 4 lines for you (I'll paste 2 + 2)
dpkg --get-selections [pattern...]
dpkg --set-selections
I think there may be ways to do everything you want; I just don't know what they are :-)
What replaces "[pattern...] "
not sure offhand - what do you think?
easy enough to try a few tests
I will look into it all. Thanks for the headstart!
lemmee know how it goes :-)
Yeah I will let you know how it goes. I won't try anything until tmwo though.
there's gftp, which is adequate
What do I type into console to upgrad to 5.10?
there's a factoid for that IIRC
how do I use factoids?

I am very frustrated. Maybe you can help. gftp, the only ftp client people recomend for linux, does not transfer completely, if i tell it to move a directory that has directories under it, it will not go down into it...
if that makes any sense. I will tell it to move the directory drupal, and it will take drupal and the files inside it, but if there are directories inside drupal it wont take them...
